meanings.definition: sassabies: a type of antelope found in southern Africa
meanings.sent1: The sassabies grazed peacefully in the grasslands.
meanings.sent2: I saw a herd of sassabies while on safari in Africa.
meanings.sent3: The sassabies decided to have a race to see who was the fastest antelope.
meanings.sent4: The grace and beauty of the sassabies reminded me of a painting.
meanings.sent5: The children were amazed by the colorful coats of the sassabies.

meanings.definition: sassabies: plural form of sassaby, referring to more than one individual of the species
meanings.sent1: Look at all the sassabies running across the savannah!
meanings.sent2: The sassabies gathered around the watering hole to drink.
meanings.sent3: The sassabies held a meeting to discuss their migration plans.
meanings.sent4: The sun set behind the silhouette of the sassabies, creating a stunning image.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the sassabies' hooves echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: sassabies: to behave in a bold, cheeky, or impudent manner
meanings.sent1: She sassabies her way through the party, charming everyone with her wit.
meanings.sent2: The child decided to sassabies the teacher by talking back in class.
meanings.sent3: The monkey sassabies around by stealing bananas from the market.
meanings.sent4: His confidence allowed him to sassabies his way into getting what he wanted.
meanings.sent5: The comedian loved to sassabies the audience with his jokes and funny stories.
